item.title: 石破首相表示日本将继续与美国进行贸易谈判
item.description: 日本首相石破茂周二表示，日本将继续与美国谈判，寻求达成一项对两国都有利的双边贸易协议。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said on Tuesday that Japan would continue negotiations with the United States to seek a bilateral trade deal that benefits both countries.】

item.title: 巴西 XP 在纽约起诉做空机构 Grizzly Research，指控其诽谤
item.description: 巴西金融科技公司 XP 周一在美国提起诉讼，指控做空机构 Grizzly Research 在 3 月 12 日的一份报告中诽谤 XP，该报告指控 XP 经营 "类似麦道夫的庞氏骗局"。【原文：The Brazilian fintech company XP filed a U.S. lawsuit on Monday accusing the short seller Grizzly Research of defamation over a March 12 report accusing XP of running a "Madoff-like Ponzi scheme."】

item.title: Cathie Wood's Ark 申请新 ETF 以限制旗舰基金的损失
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的方舟投资管理公司（Ark Investment Management）已提交了四只新交易所交易基金的提案，旨在缓解其旗舰基金 ARK Innovation 基金的潜在损失。【原文：Cathie Wood's Ark Investment Management has filed proposals for four new exchange-traded funds that aim to cushion potential losses in its flagship ARK Innovation fund .】

item.title: 三星预计第二季度营业利润下降 56%，远低于预期
item.description: 三星电子周二预计，第二季度营业利润将同比下降 56%，远远低于分析师的预期。【原文：Samsung Electronics on Tuesday projected a 56% drop in second-quarter operating profit from a year earlier, missing analysts' estimates by far.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果公司高级人工智能主管庞若明将前往 Meta 公司工作
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，苹果公司负责人工智能模型的高级主管庞若明（Ruoming Pang）即将离开公司，前往 Meta Platforms 工作。【原文：Apple's top executive in charge of artificial intelligence models, Ruoming Pang, is leaving the company for Meta Platforms , Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普行政令寻求终止风能和太阳能补贴
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一指示联邦机构加强《美丽大法案》（One Big Beautiful Bill Act）中废除或修改太阳能和风能项目税收抵免的条款。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday directed federal agencies to strengthen provisions in the One Big Beautiful Bill Act that repeal or modify tax credits for solar and wind energy projects.】

item.title: 加拿大 Aura Minerals 公司准备在纳斯达克上市，目标估值 21 亿美元
item.description: 加拿大金铜矿商 Aura Minerals 周一表示，该公司正准备将其股票在纳斯达克上市，此举可能为该公司带来 21.4 亿美元的估值。【原文：Canadian gold and copper miner Aura Minerals is preparing to list its shares on the Nasdaq, the company said on Monday, in a move that could fetch the company a valuation of $2.14 billion.】

item.title: 研究称，放弃欧盟 2035 年零排放汽车目标将危及 100 万个工作岗位
item.description: 运输与环境运动组织周二发表的一份研究报告显示，如果欧盟坚持2035年的清洁汽车目标，并实施支持转型的政策，欧洲汽车业的年产量将恢复到1680万辆，与2008年危机后的峰值持平。【原文：Europe's car industry could return to producing 16.8 million cars a year, equalling its post-2008 crisis peak, if the European Union maintains its 2035 clean cars target and implements policies to support the transition, a study published by campaign group Transport & Environment showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 瑞银必须面对瑞士信贷破产引发的美国投资者诉讼
item.description: 一名美国法官周一裁定，瑞银必须面对投资者的两起诉讼，这些投资者称，瑞银前身瑞士信贷在 2023 年 3 月倒闭之前，对其财务状况作出了虚假和误导性陈述，从而欺骗了他们。【原文：UBS must face two lawsuits by investors who said the former Credit Suisse defrauded them prior to its March 2023 demise with false and misleading statements about its financial condition, a U.S. judge ruled on Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普签署行政命令，将关税最后期限延长至 8 月 1 日
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一签署了一项行政命令，将所谓的 "互惠 "关税生效日期延长至8月1日。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump signed an executive order Monday extending the date on which so-called "reciprocal" tariffs will take effect to August 1.】

item.title: 加州未能阻止 23andMe 创始人重新收购公司
item.description: 基因检测公司 23andMe 将以 3.05 亿美元的价格出售给该公司的联合创始人安妮-沃西基（Anne Wojcicki），此前美国破产法官驳回了加利福尼亚州的请求，即在该州就与该交易相关的隐私问题提出上诉期间推迟出售。【原文：Genetic testing company 23andMe can proceed with a $305 million sale to the company’s co-founder Anne Wojcicki after a U.S. bankruptcy judge rejected California's bid to delay the sale while the state appeals over privacy concerns related to the deal.】

item.title: 韩国将在 8 月 1 日关税生效前加强与美国的贸易谈判
item.description: 韩国表示计划加强与美国的贸易谈判，并认为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划从8月1日起征收25%的关税实际上是延长了实施对等关税的宽限期。【原文：South Korea said it planned to intensify trade talks with the United States and considers U.S. President Donald Trump's plan for a 25% tariff from August 1 as effectively extending a grace period on implementing reciprocal tariffs.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳航称数据泄露一周后与网络罪犯取得联系
item.description: 澳大利亚航空公司发言人周二告诉路透社，上周发生的数据泄露事件暴露了 600 万客户的个人信息，一名网络罪犯已与该公司取得联系。【原文：A cyber criminal has made contact with Australia's Qantas following a data breach last week that exposed personal information of six million customers, a company spokesperson told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 交易日 关税标题和搬迁期限
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 埃克森发出信号，石油和天然气价格下跌可能打击第二季度利润
item.description: 埃克森美孚（Exxon Mobil）周一表示，石油和天然气价格下跌可能使其第二季度盈利比上一季度减少约 15 亿美元。【原文：Exxon Mobil signaled on Monday that lower oil and gas prices could cut its second-quarter earnings by about $1.5 billion from the previous quarter's level.】

item.title: 欧盟消息人士称，欧盟回避美国关税信函，希望美国做出让步
item.description: 熟悉内情的欧盟消息人士周一告诉路透社，欧盟将不会收到美国规定提高关税的信函，欧盟正在考虑可能豁免美国征收 10%的基准税率。【原文：The European Union will not receive a letter from the United States setting out higher tariffs, EU sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday, and is eyeing possible exemptions from the U.S. baseline levy of 10%.】

item.title: 美国提出可提高美国西部石油和天然气产量的规定
item.description: 美国内政部周一提议修改规则，允许能源公司更容易地将使用同一井台的多个租约的石油和天然气产出合并起来，据说这样每年可为该行业节省多达 18 亿美元。【原文：The U.S. Interior Department on Monday proposed rule changes to allow energy companies to more easily combine oil and gas output from multiple leases using the same well pad, which could save the industry as much as $1.8 billion per year, it said.】

item.title: 路威酩轩集团（LVMH）资深员工迈克尔-伯克（Michael Burke）将负责美国和其他业务
item.description: 奢侈品集团路威酩轩集团（LVMH）首席执行官贝尔纳-阿诺特（Bernard Arnault）在周一给员工的一份备忘录中表示，该集团已任命首席执行官贝尔纳-阿诺特（Bernard Arnault）最信任的顾问之一、长期担任集团高管的迈克尔-伯克（Michael Burke）为路威酩轩美洲公司（LVMH Americas）负责人。【原文：Luxury goods group LVMH has named longtime executive Michael Burke, one of CEO Bernard Arnault's most trusted advisers, as head of LVMH Americas, the company's unit for North and South America, Arnault said in a memo to staff on Monday.】

item.title: 墨西哥将于 2026 年开设苍蝇不育工厂以防治螺旋虫
item.description: 墨西哥政府周一表示，已开始在该国南部建造一座耗资 5100 万美元的设施，作为防治螺旋虫工作的一部分。【原文：Mexico's government said on Monday that it has started to build a $51 million facility in the country's south as part of an effort to combat screwworm, a pest that has disrupted Mexican exports of cattle to the United States.】

item.title: 涉足政治的美国公司负责人
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）上周在社交媒体上宣布，在对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的全面税收和支出法案提出严厉批评后，他将在美国成立一个名为 "美国党"（America Party）的新政党。在今年早些时候开始闹翻之前，马斯克一直是总统的亲密盟友。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk last week announced on social media the formation of a new political party in the United States called the "America Party" after heavy criticism of U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tax and spending bill. Musk had been a close ally of the president before a falling-out that began earlier this year.】

item.title: 石油价格上涨，原因是强劲的需求超过了欧佩克+的增产预期
item.description: 周一，石油上涨超过 1%，原因是有迹象表明需求强劲，摆脱了欧佩克+8 月份产量增幅高于预期的影响，以及对美国关税潜在影响的担忧。【原文：Oil rose more than 1% on Monday on signs of strong demand, shrugging off the impact of a higher-than-expected OPEC+ output hike for August as well as concerns about the potential impact of U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 消息人士称，金砖国家只有在采取被视为 "反美 "的政策时才会被征收关税
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，特朗普政府不会立即对发展中国家金砖国家集团成员征收 10%的新关税，但如果这些国家采取所谓的 "反美 "政策行动，特朗普政府将继续征收关税。【原文：The Trump administration will not immediately impose a new 10% tariff against members of the developing nation BRICS bloc, but will proceed if countries take so-called "anti-American" policy actions, according to a source familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 罢工困扰加拿大邮政，私营快递公司希望扩大市场份额
item.description: UPS、联邦快递（FedEx）和其他私营包裹承运商正忙于在近 170 亿美元的加拿大快递市场上占据更大份额，而政府所有的加拿大邮政（Canada Post）则在应对劳工动荡。【原文：UPS, FedEx and other private parcel carriers are busy cornering a bigger share of the nearly $17 billion Canadian delivery market, while government-owned Canada Post copes with labor turmoil.】

item.title: 债券持有人和竞标者准备反对黄金储备集团的 Citgo 竞标
item.description: 三位与筹备工作关系密切的消息人士称，代表委内瑞拉违约债券持有人和部分参与美国拍卖美国炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 的委内瑞拉母公司股份的投标人的律师正准备对拍卖的建议结果提出异议。【原文：Lawyers representing holders of a defaulted Venezuelan bond and some bidders that participated in a U.S. auction of shares in the Venezuelan parent of U.S. refiner Citgo Petroleum are getting ready to object to the auction's recommended outcome, three sources close to the preparations said.】

item.title: 美联储文件称利率仍有回落至接近零的风险
item.description: 纽约和旧金山联邦储备银行联合发表的一篇新论文称，尽管目前短期借贷成本相对较高，但美联储在未来几年的某个时候再次将短期利率目标设定在接近于零的水平的前景仍然真实存在。【原文：The prospect of the Federal Reserve once again setting its short-term interest rate target at near zero levels at some point in coming years remains real despite current relatively high levels of short-term borrowing costs, a new paper published jointly between the New York and San Francisco Federal Reserve banks said.】

item.title: 戴姆勒卡车公司宣布回购 20 亿欧元股票
item.description: 全球最大的卡车制造商之一戴姆勒卡车控股公司（Daimler Truck Holding）周一表示，将实施一项新的股票回购计划，价值高达 20 亿欧元（23.5 亿美元）。【原文：Daimler Truck Holding , one of the world's biggest truckmakers, said on Monday it would conduct a new share buyback program worth up to 2 billion euros ($2.35 billion).】

item.title: 特朗普表示将对日本和韩国征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，他将从8月1日起对来自日本和韩国的商品征收25%的关税，并在其社交媒体平台上发布了致这两个国家领导人的信函。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said he would impose a 25% tariff on goods from Japan and South Korea starting on August 1, posting letters to the leaders of those countries on his social media platform.】

item.title: 纽蒙特公司将解雇苏里南梅里安矿至少 10%的员工
item.description: 全球最大的上市金矿企业纽蒙特公司周五宣布，以产量下降为由，将在苏里南的梅里安矿裁员 10%至 15%。【原文：Newmont, the world's largest listed gold miner, announced on Friday that it would lay off 10% to 15% of its workforce at its Merian mine in Suriname, citing production declines.】

item.title: 雪佛龙准备快速完成赫斯交易，并等待埃克森争端的结果
item.description: 据两位消息人士和一位行业分析师透露，雪佛龙公司正在为迅速完成对小型石油生产商赫斯公司的收购计划奠定基础，包括为部分赫斯公司员工准备遣散计划。【原文：Chevron is laying the groundwork to swiftly close its planned acquisition of smaller oil producer Hess , according to two sources and an industry analyst, including by preparing a severance program for some Hess workers.】

item.title: 美国财政部称允许卸载部分液化石油气货物
item.description: 美国财政部网站周一发布通知称，特朗普政府决定允许委内瑞拉石油公司（PDVSA.UL）在 9 月 5 日之前卸载液化石油气，条件是这些气体必须在 7 月 7 日或之前装船。【原文：The Trump administration moved to allow the offloading of liquefied petroleum gas involving Petroleos de Venezuela SA (PDVSA.UL) until September 5, provided that the gas was loaded on a vessel on or before July 7, according to a notice posted to the U.S. Treasury Department website on Monday.】
